useStmt.citReq:
Publications and research reports based on the IPUMS-PMA database must cite it appropriately. The citation should include the following:
Elizabeth Heger Boyle, Devon Kristiansen, and Matthew Sobek. IPUMS-PMA: Version 1.0 [dataset] Minneapolis, MN: IPUMS, 2018. https://doi.org/10.18128/D081.V1.0
The licensing agreement for use of IPUMS-PMA data requires that users supply us with the title and full citation for any publications, research reports, or educational materials making use of the data or documentation. Please add your citation to the IPUMS bibliography at http://bibliography.ipums.org/.
useStmt.conditions:
Users of IPUMS-PMA data must agree to abide by the conditions of use. A user's license is valid for one year and may be renewed. Users must agree to the following conditions:
(1) No fees may be charged for use or distribution of the data.
(2) Cite IPUMS appropriately. For information on proper citation, refer to the citation requirement section of this DDI document.
(3) Tell us about any work you do using the IPUMS. Publications, research reports, or presentations making use of IPUMS-PMA should be added to our Bibliography. Continued funding for the IPUMS depends on our ability to show our sponsor agencies that researchers are using the data for productive purposes.
(4) The IPUMS cannot be used for genealogical research
(5) It is difficult to use the IPUMS to study small geographic areas. In the IPUMS census samples for years 1940-present, no places having a population of fewer than 100,000 persons can be identified.
(6) Use it for GOOD -- never for EVIL.
(7) Please notify ipums@umn.edu regarding errors in the data or documentation.
useStmt.disclaimer: The user of the data acknowledges that the original collector of the data, the authorized distributor of the data, and the relevant funding agency bear no responsibility for use of the data or for interpretations or inferences based upon such uses.

stdyDscr.notes: User-provided description: female respondent dataset for example sdp-merge

fileTxt.filePlac: Minnesota Population Center, 50 Willey Hall, 225 - 19th Avenue South, Minneapolis, MN 55455

var.name: SAMPLE
var.txt: SAMPLE is an IPUMS-generated variable that identifies the PMA sample from which the record is drawn. In some countries and years, PMA conducts more than one round of the survey. The data from each round are separately identified. In some cases, data from the same country and same round might have been split into more than one file according to geographic region.

catgry.labl: Ethiopia 2016/7 Maternal and Newborn Health Round 1

var.name: COUNTRY
var.txt: COUNTRY reports the country where the survey was fielded.

var.name: YEAR
var.txt: YEAR reports the year when the survey was fielded. Some interviews may have occurred early in the following year. YEAR does not reflect individual interview years.

var.name: ROUND
var.labl: PMA survey round in this country
var.txt: ROUND reports the survey round within a given country (1st, 2nd, etc.). In some cases, more than one round of the survey was fielded in the same year.
var.codInstr: ROUND is an integer variable that represents the round of the survey within that country.

var.name: HHID
var.txt:
HHID is an IPUMS-constructed variable that uniquely identifies households. HHID is a concatenation of enumeration area ID number (EAID), a count variable starting from one corresponding to each value of HHIDORIG, year (YEAR), and round (ROUND).
For cases where HHIDORIG is missing, HHID is a concatenation of enumeration area ID (EAID), household structure number (STRUCTURNO), household number within structure (HHNUM), year (YEAR), and round (ROUND).
HHID does not allow users to link records of households that have been interviewed in more than one round of survey of PMA.
A different construction is used for cases in which STRUCTURNO and/or HHNUM are missing, or if EAID is not available. See the Comparability tab for more details.
var.codInstr: This is a 26-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: PERSONID
var.txt: PERSONID is an IPUMS-constructed variable that uniquely identifies individuals in household and female files across all samples. PERSONID is a concatenation of the IPUMS-constructed variable HHID, a variable that uniquely identifies households, and LINENO, which is the person's reference number within the household.
var.codInstr: This is a 32-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: ELIGIBLE
var.txt: ELIGIBLE identifies women aged 15 to 49 who were eligible to answer the female questionnaire. It is possible to have multiple eligible women in the same household, or no eligible women in the household.

var.name: EAID
var.txt:
EAID reports the geographic enumeration area where the respondent was located. The EAID is the primary sampling unit for IPUMS PMA. Due to privacy concerns, the borders of these enumeration areas are not publicly available and the enumeration area is specified via an assigned number rather than a recognized name for a locale.
Enumeration areas do not cover all areas within each survey country. After 5 survey rounds using the same enumeration areas, PMA identifies new enumeration areas. Due to this sampling design, some households, eligible women respondents, or service delivery points might be selected to be interviewed in more than one survey within a 5 year period. The variables PREVINTERVIEWHQ, PREVINTERVIEWFQ, and PREVINTERVIEWSQ identifies household, female, and service delivery point respondents, respectively, who have been interviewed for PMA in a previous round. It is not possible, however, to link survey records for the same person between rounds.
var.codInstr: This is a 10-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: CONSENTFQ
var.labl: Female respondent provided consent to be interviewed
var.txt: CONSENTFQ indicates whether or not the respondent to the female questionnaire completed the survey. The variable RESULTFQ provides more detail regarding why the interview was not conducted or completed.

var.name: CONSENTHQ
var.labl: Household respondent provided consent to be interviewed
var.txt: CONSENTHQ indicates whether or not the respondent for the household survey consented to be interviewed and completed the survey. The variable RESULTHQ provides more detail regarding why the interview was not conducted or completed.

var.name: FQWEIGHT
var.txt:
FQWEIGHT is a nationally representative inverse probability weight for respondents of the female questionnaire. FQWEIGHT should be used in analyses of all questions on the female questionnaire. FQWEIGHT controls for female non-response, but because all eligible females in the household responded to the questionnaire, respondent selection probability does not need to be controlled for. For more details on how FQWEIGHT was calculated, please see the Weighting Memo [URL omitted from DDI.] from the PMA team.
For person records who were not women aged 15 to 49, the value of FQWEIGHT is zero.
var.codInstr: This variable is a 17-digit variable with decimal points. All cases that are missing or NIU (not in universe) are coded as zero.

var.name: STRATA
var.txt:
STRATA defines the stratification for each sample. Some countries use only urban/rural stratification, others use regions, and some use both levels of stratification. Users may use STRATA and EAID (the primary sampling unit) to adjust sampling errors to account for sampling design of IPUMS-PMA samples.
For more information on sample design for IPUMS-PMA surveys, see the sampling design memo [URL omitted from DDI.] for households and women.

var.name: FPPROVIDERGEN
var.labl: First source of recent or current FP method, general
var.txt:
FPPROVIDERGEN reports where the woman first received her recent or current family planning method in the general categories of public, private, NGO or other. A related variable, FPPROVIDER, also reports where the woman first received her recent or current family planning method and retains all details from country-specific response categories.
The question associated with this variable was included in the female questionnaire.

var.name: FPPROVIDER
var.labl: First source of recent or current FP method, detailed
var.txt:
FPPROVIDER reports where the woman first received her recent or current family planning method. FPPROVIDER retains all detail from country-specific response categories. A general version of this variable can be found in FPPROVIDERGEN.
The question associated with this variable was included in the female questionnaire.

catgry.labl: Centre de la Mere de l'Enfant
Mobile clinic (not specified as public or private)
Health agent or community health worker (not specified as public or private)

var.name: FPGETDESIRED
var.labl: Were able to obtain preferred method of contraception
var.txt:
For a woman who used a modern family planning method in the past 12 months (MCP and FPBEGINUSECMC), FPGETDESIRED reports if she was able to obtain the family planning method that she wanted to delay or avoid getting pregnant when she first obtained her current or most recent method of contraception.
The question associated with this variable was included in the female questionnaire.

var.name: FPGETDESIREDWHY
var.labl: Why did not obtain preferred family planning method
var.txt:
For a woman who used a modern family planning method in the past 12 months (FPCURRECUSER) and was not able to obtain her desired form of contraception (FPGETDESIRED), FPGETDESIREDWHY reports why the woman was not able to obtain the family planning method that she wanted to delay or avoid getting pregnant when she first obtained her current or most recent method of contraception ( FPBEGINUSECMC ).
The question associated with this variable was included in the female questionnaire.

var.name: FPDECIDEMETHOD
var.labl: Who made final decision about the method
var.txt:
For women who have used a family planning method in the past 12 months, FPDECIDEMETHOD reports who made the final decision about what method to use.
The question associated with this variable was included in the female questionnaire.

var.name: FPPAYLASTAMT
var.labl: Amount of payment for FP service last time obtained FP method
var.txt:
FPPAYLASTAMT reports the amount in the local currency the woman paid for family planning services when she last obtained a family planning method, if she last obtained a family planning method within the last 12 months.
The question associated with this variable was included in the female questionnaire.
var.codInstr:
This is a numeric variable that represents the amount in the local currency the woman paid for family planning services, except for the following codes:
99999995 = Not interviewed (female questionnaire) 99999996 = Not interviewed (household questionnaire) 99999997 = Don't know 99999998 = No response or missing 99999999 = NIU (not in universe)
